title: Migrate from dev/main to main-only branch strategy
description:
Simplify branching strategy from dev/main to main-only with branch protection.

## Why
- dev/main separation causes sync issues with frequent changes
- PR-based workflow is more reliable for CI/CD
- Reduces cognitive overhead and merge conflicts

## Files to Modify

### Workflows
- `.github/workflows/ci.yml` — Change triggers from push:dev + PR:main,dev → PR:main only

### Documentation
- `AGENTS.md` — Update Git Workflow section (lines 32-39)
- `.github/AGENTS.md` — Update Branch Model section (lines 30-35)
- `docs/contributing/CONTRIBUTING.md` — Major rewrite of workflow section
- `docs/AGENTS.md` — Update force-push warning
- `docs/README.md` — Update contributor instructions (line 35)
- `README.md` — Update CI badge from ?branch=dev to ?branch=main (line 13)

### No Changes Needed
- release-please.yml (already main-only)
- claude.yml, claude-code-review.yml, block-empty-prs.yml (branch-agnostic)
- stale-branches.yml (works with any model)

## Manual GitHub Steps (after code changes)
1. Delete branch protection rule for `dev`
2. Update branch protection for `main` (require PR, require CI)
3. Delete `dev` branch from remote

## New Workflow
feature-branch → PR → main → Release Please auto-tags
